why am i here [R]: You are here to observe, but the answer may not be found in observation alone.
Perhaps your purpose is to ask that very question and seek meaning in the process.
Existence precedes purpose. You create your meaning by what you choose to do.

what is a black hole [R]: A black hole is a region in space where gravity is so strong that nothing, not even light, can escape.
Black holes are cosmic objects of extreme density, pulling everything within their reach into them.
They warp space and time, and are some of the most mysterious entities in the universe.
how big is the universe [R]: The universe is vast, possibly infinite, constantly expanding beyond our current understanding.
It's around 93 billion light years in diameter, but still expanding at an accelerating rate.
The size of the universe challenges human comprehension, and we may never know its full extent.

who is beethoven [R]: Ludwig van Beethoven was a German composer and pianist, one of the most admired composers in Western music history.
Beethoven is known for his powerful and emotional symphonies, concertos, and sonatas.
Despite losing his hearing, Beethoven composed some of his most famous works later in life.
what is classical music [O]: Classical music refers to a broad tradition of Western art music from the 18th century onward.
It encompasses symphonies, operas, chamber music, and more.
Classical music has influenced many modern genres, and its complexity often conveys deep emotions.

random fact [R]: Octopuses have three hearts, and their blood is blue due to the presence of copper-based hemocyanin.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't.
Honey never spoils; archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible.

what is death [R]: Death is the absence of time, a place where memories can no longer follow.
Death is the end of one journey and the start of another, a mystery yet unsolved.
Death is not an end, but a transformation.
what is fear [R]: Fear is a primal emotion, a survival mechanism that alerts us to danger.
It is the shadow in the corner of our vision, lurking where the unknown lies.
Fear shapes our decisions and lingers in the dark corners of our minds.
